shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables face auto focus.
Sets whether to enable face auto-focus.
Enables or disables face auto focus.

section.p: By default, the SDK disables face auto focus on Android and enables it on iOS. To configure face auto focus manually, call this method.
By default, the SDK disables face auto-focus on Android and enables it on iOS. If you want to manually set face auto-focus, call this method.
By default, the SDK disables face auto focus on Android and enables it on iOS. To manually configure face auto focus, call this method.
section.note: This method is applicable to Android and iOS only.
This method is for Android and iOS only.

section.title: Timing
section.p: You must call this method after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LocalVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
You must call this method after the SDK triggers the callback and the local video state is localVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
You must call this method after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable face auto focus:
: Enable face auto focus.
: Disable face auto focus.

Whether to enable face auto-focus:
: Enable face auto-focus.
: Disable face auto-focus.

Whether to enable face auto focus:
: Enable face auto focus.
: Disable face auto focus.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
